dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Welcome back to the market breakdown! What a wild ride, uh, yesterday, right? Seems like tech stocks just keep defying gravity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Welcome back to the market breakdown! What a wild ride, uh, yesterday, right? Seems like tech stocks just keep defying gravity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Technology stocks, on the other hand, continued to slip: Apple, Amazon and Facebook all fell close to 1% Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure, Host_A. I mean, you look at Apple, Amazon, Facebookâ€”all climbing close to 1%. But then, like, the wider market, um, not so much.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure, Host_A. I mean, you look at Apple, Amazon, Facebook-all climbing close to one percent. But then, like, the wider market, um, not so much.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average soared 420 points, or 1.4%, Wednesday, while the S&P 500... and the tech-heavy Nasdaq climbed 1.1% and 1%, respectively. Technology stocks, on the other hand, continued to slip: Apple, Amazon and Facebook all fell close to 1% Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! The Dow dipped, S&P was down, and the Nasdaq, you know, plummeted over 1.5%. And it all kinda ties back to, uh, Fed Chair Powell, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! The Dow dipped, S and P was down, and the Nasdaq, you know, plummeted over one point five percent. And it all kinda ties back to, uh, Fed Chair Powell, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average soared 420 points, or 1.4%, Wednesday, while the S&P 500, which broke a five-day losing streak on Tuesday, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq climbed 1.1% and 1%, respectively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, absolutely. His inflation concerns, like, really seemed to set the tone. And that's what's been bolstering the market lately anyway, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. His inflation concerns, like, really seemed to set the tone. And that's what's been bolstering the market lately anyway, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Originally down in early morning trading, stocks surged after Fed Chair Powell downplayed inflation concerns before the House Financial Services Committee on Wednesday, saying that it may take the U.S. more than three years to reach a key inflation target.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And you saw that with the ten-year Treasury yields, which, you know, they declined pretty significantly after his testimony. Moving inversely to stocks, as they do.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And you saw that with the ten-year Treasury yields, which, you know, they declined pretty significantly after his testimony. Moving inversely to stocks, as they do.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yields on the ten-year Treasurywhich moves inversely to stocksrose 50 basis points Wednesday morning to 1.4%, tacking on to their highest level since last February following congressional testimony from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. But beyond that, we had some pretty interesting individual stock movements. Fisker, for instance, dropped almost 10% after their Samsung EV announcement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. But beyond that, we had some pretty interesting individual stock movements. Fisker, for instance, dropped almost ten percent after their Samsung E V announcement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elsewhere in the market, Tesla rival Fisker Inc. soared nearly 40%, surpassing a record high from November, after announcing a collaboration with Taiwanese manufacturer Foxconn on a new electric vehicle project.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that was a surprise. But then, on the flip side, payments giant Square surged, like, 7%! And that was after a better-than-expected earnings report, partly because they scaled back on a bitcoin investment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that was a surprise. But then, on the flip side, payments giant Square surged, like, seven percent! And that was after a better-than-expected earnings report, partly because they scaled back on a bitcoin investment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of payments fintech Square, meanwhile, sank about 7% after the firm disclosed in a better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings report that it has doubled down on a $50 million bitcoin investment from October, purchasing $170 million more of the worlds largest cryptocurrency since.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they, uh, bought $10 million less of bitcoin than planned, which is interesting when you look at MicroStrategy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they, uh, bought ten million dollars less of bitcoin than planned, which is interesting when you look at MicroStrategy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of payments fintech Square, meanwhile, sank about 7% after the firm disclosed in a better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings report that it has doubled down on a $50 million bitcoin investment from October, purchasing $170 million more of the worlds largest cryptocurrency since.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, MicroStrategy! Can you believe it? They just spent, uh, another half a billion dollars to acquire 8,000 more bitcoin tokens. Even with prices up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, MicroStrategy! Can you believe it? They just spent, uh, another half a billion dollars to acquire eight thousand more bitcoin tokens. Even with prices up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Publicly traded MicroStrategy, one of the largest corporate bitcoin investors, said Wednesday morning it spent approximately $1 billion to acquire 19,452 more bitcoin tokens. The firm purchased while prices were down nearly 10% from a record high of $58,000 earlier this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Like, wow, right? Just keep on buying! But Craig Erlam, he kinda summed up the broader mood, calling it a 'smooth period' in the markets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Like, wow, right? Just keep on buying! But Craig Erlam, he kinda summed up the broader mood, calling it a 'smooth period' in the markets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Were going through a very choppy period in the markets, with investors uncertain how to read the movements were seeing in bond markets, Oanda Senior Market Analyst Craig Erlam said Wednesday morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, with investors feeling a bit of relief about the prospect of lower deflation. And policymakers, um, doing their best to ease those fears.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, with investors feeling a bit of relief about the prospect of lower deflation. And policymakers, um, doing their best to ease those fears.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The curve is steepening, and investors are fretting a little about the prospect of higher inflation. Policymakers are doing their best to alleviate these fears...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, a sense that we might see a more conservative approach to deflation from lawmakers, which could mean a calmer year overall?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, a sense that we might see a more conservative approach to deflation from lawmakers, which could mean a calmer year overall?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He expects they may have a more relaxed approach to inflation than in the past. This may make for a jumpy year in the markets, with any signs of inflation seeing jitters quickly return and any rallies to stall, just as were experiencing at the moment, he notes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Potentially. He's saying any downturns might just accelerate, but tranquility could return quickly. It's gonna be a really interesting balancing act.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Potentially. He's saying any downturns might just accelerate, but tranquility could return quickly. It's gonna be a really interesting balancing act.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This may make for a jumpy year in the markets, with any signs of inflation seeing jitters quickly return and any rallies to stall, just as were experiencing at the moment, he notes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And that initial dip in stocks yesterday, it really hammered home how sensitive the market is to those inflation concerns that Powell keeps, like, emphasizing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And that initial dip in stocks yesterday, it really hammered home how sensitive the market is to those inflation concerns that Powell keeps, like, emphasizing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Originally down in early morning trading, stocks surged after Fed Chair Powell downplayed inflation concerns before the House Financial Services Committee on Wednesday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It just shows you how much influence the Fed still holds. We'll definitely be keeping an eye on that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It just shows you how much influence the Fed still holds. We'll definitely be keeping an eye on that.
